title: [SOLVED]820-2915 2011 15" Graphics
message:
First I will preface this with I am new to macbook repairs, I have the above referenced board that was showing
fine diagonal lines, get almost to desktop then reboot, hot in center of board. I took this to be the graphics chip problem,
since I am new and need practice I took the heat shield off, cleaned all the old paste off both the cpu and gpu, practiced
using my quick on the amd chip, I can't think I did it long enough to melt any solder but let cool, re-pasted the two
chips, put the heat sink back on and it boots fine, lines in screen are gone and no longer hot, has been running about
an hour..

So my question is, is this only temporary and the issues will return?

title: [SOLVED]820-2915 2011 15" Graphics
message:
As any other reflow, it can last 1 year, 2 months, or maybe just 3 hours...
Chip must be changed; get a "real" new one, is other problem nowadays.

You must understand that the chip itself has an issue inside, is not a problem of solder balls.

title: [SOLVED]820-2915 2011 15" Graphics
message: Thanks, that is what I suspected but wanted to confirm.  No plans to attempt GPU replacement at this point.
